senses.sense_definition: A formal ball, often serving as a coming-of-age party to present young women to society.

examples.text: Her parents were proud to present her to the community at the annual <w>cotillion</w>.
We received an invitation to the spring <w>cotillion</w> held at the country club.

senses.sense_definition: An elaborate group dance involving complex figures and changing partners, popular in the 18th and 19th centuries.

examples.text: The guests gathered in the ballroom to dance a lively <w>cotillion</w>.
She spent weeks learning the steps for the <w>cotillion</w> before the historical reenactment.

traits.comment: referring to the specific dance form

senses.sense_definition: The music composed or played to accompany a cotillion dance.

examples.text: The orchestra began to play a cheerful <w>cotillion</w> for the dancers.
He composed a new <w>cotillion</w> specifically for the festive occasion.
The couples <w>cotillioned</w> across the floor with grace and precision.
They <w>cotillioned</w> late into the night during the grand celebration.
